Title: 1977 来日公演　カラヤン　ベルリン・フィル　運命交響曲(Humonkan Live 1977) Remaster Sound (HI-RES)
Description:
Beethoven Symphony NR.5 
1977 TOKYO Humonkan live  HERBERT VON KARAJAN & Berliner Philharmoniker .  Karajan Japan Tour 1977　　TV Asahi  
ONKYO DOLBY wide Stereo (24/96) remaster sound
カラヤン日本公演ツアー1977年　普門館ライブ
「私はほぼ日本国民であります」1973＆1988に述べた日本を愛した
カラヤンの意気込みを感じる運命ライブです。
この日のプログラムは前半が田園交響曲、休憩後にこの運命です。
今では動員されない作曲家指定2管編成をカラヤンの指示による
ダブリングの4管編成での演奏です。人数が１００人を超える相当のものです。
（録音時も4管編成です）
第1バイオリンだけで18人、第2バイオリンが14，ヴィオラ12、チェロ12，
コントラバス10，木管オール4、トランペット4，ホルン4，トロンボーン、ティンパニです。
この時はまだウィーンフィルと同じヘッケル・トランペットを使用していましたが、
79年からドイツのモンケ・トランペットのプロト・タイプに変更、1980年からはベルリンフィル専用モデルのモンケ・トランペットに変わり、80年代の運命交響曲の金管のトーンはまた違って聞こえます。

저는 일본국민이라 해도 과언아닙니다. 1973/1988년에 언급한
그의 일본사랑을 강조한 카라얀의 의지가 담긴 운명교향곡 라이브.
이날은 전반 전원교향곡 휴식후 운명교향곡을 얀주한 말이었습니다. 이제는 누구도 동원되지않는 다블링 방식의 4관퍈성의 베토벤 시리즈를 라이브로 느낄수 있는 영상입니다.
(녹음시도 4관입니다) 
실은 카라얀은 75년에 오랫동안의 목디스크가 극에 달해 모든 프러그램을 취소하고 3개월간 휴식응 가지고 
77년경부터는 연주후 휴게실서 기절하듯이 누워버리는 증상이 있어 해외에사도 우려히는 말들이 나왔습니다.
익년 78년 9월 뇌졸증으로 쓰러져 우측 마비가.발생.
54년 첫 방일시도 우측 마비가 약간 발생해 나고야대학병원에 1일 입원힌 적있을 정도로 질병이 있었습니다.
(반복적 과속 자동차와 바이크 사고로 열차에 돌진한 사고가 있음. 이건희 회장과 같은 사고로 유사한 증세로 말년에 걷지못한 증상이 됨) 
빈휠과 같은 헤켈 트럽펫을 79년까지 사용해왔고 
80년에 베를린 휠 전용 몽케 트럼펫으로 교체하여 80년대는 금관사운드가 변합니다. ( 빈휠은 77년 겨울부터 야마하 악기로 변경)

Title: 1977 来日公演　カラヤン・ベルリン・フィル「田園」交響曲 (Humonkan Live 1977 TOKYO) Remaster Sound (HI-RES)
Description:
1977 来日公演　カラヤン　娘たちとペンでサインを披露します。
カラヤンは生涯、サイン会を一切しませんでした。
サインはせいぜい演奏会後のホールを出た時に、ロールスロイスかポルシェの
ボンネットで3枚程度は描いてくれた程度です。
公式サイン会は唯一日本だけです。カラヤンは日本語で「カラヤン」と書く練習を
1954年に既にしており、どこでも「カラヤン」と日本語で書けるんだと
娘たちに自慢していたそうです。
Hebert von Karajan  BEETHOVEN Symphony NR.6 [Pastoral] 
Berliner Philharmoniker 1977 TOKYO HUMON KAN HALL TV Asahi 

ベルリン・フィル　交響曲第6番　Patoral「田園」(Humonkan Live 1977) Remaster Sound (HI-RES)
1975年にはすべてのプログラムをキャンセルして首の脊髄手術を行い復帰を果たしますが、この77年公演でも既に体力を一部失い休憩室でぐったりするほどになっていたという記録があります。翌年には脳卒中を起こし麻痺を患いますが、79年には指揮する前からぐったりするほど体調の不調を訴えるようになっていたようです。既にプログラムや契約の日程は1985年までぎっしりであり、365日の間休みがほとんどなかったようです。
1988年の最後の来日には、前日のベルリンでの国家行事である十字国民栄誉賞をドタキャンしてベルリンフィルと来日するほどの最後の意欲を見せ、私たちを号泣させてくださったことを覚えています。
1977年はそれでも、まだ気力と自信に満ち溢れ、指揮するその容姿から
圧倒的なカリスマ性で聴衆を魅了させるものがあります。

카라얀은 다른 히르텔, 번스타인, 무라빈스키, 리햐르크슈트라우스와 
마찬가지로 대단한 친일가로 알려져 있었으며, 
일본어로 자필 カラヤン 이라고 카타카나 표기로 쓸 줄 알았습니다.
1954년 첫 방일시에 습득하였다고 합니다. 
나는 일본국민이나 마찬가지다 라고 말한것 처럼 일본에 대한 역사와 
군국주의 민족성 정치성 문화에 깊은 지식이 남달랐다고 합니다.
첫딸 이사벨로 의하면 카라얀은 일본 관련 서적만으로 1200책을 모두 읽었다고 합니다. 미국 유럽 연주보다도 일본 연주일정이 더욱 길고 일본 지방 소도시까지 돌며, 베를린 휠과 구청 강당에서 연주회를 펼칠 정도였습니다.
(1957/1966/1970)
그와 틀어질때까지 틀어진 베를린 휠도 결국은 일본청중들의 인기와 
일본 미디어에서의 카라얀 Remaster 판등의 제작열정에 밀려
최근에는 라디오 방송에서도 카라얀 특집을 자주 하게 되었습니다. 
베를린휠도 사실상 주요 프로그램은 카라얀이 인정한 제자들만 지휘를 할 수 있으며,  기금 이사회등은 일본인들로 구성되어 있습니다. 
1979년부터 Trumpet를 빈휠과 같은 헤켈 Trumpet 로부터 벗어나 
독일 MONKE Trumpet로 교체되어 금관악기의 음색이 달라졌습니다.
현재까지도 이는 카라얀이 인정한 교체설로 유명하며 (60년대 녹음을 들으면
빈휠과 같은 금관 사운드가 들립니다) 카라얀의 영향력은 무시 할 수 없습니다.

반면 빈휠도 77년부터 YAMAHA 빈휠 특수 애디션으로 교체되어 호른 트롬본까지 모두 일본제품으로 교체되어 현재에 이룹니다. 
1977년에도 이미 카라얀은 체력을 잃어가는 증세가 보여 휴게실에서 연주후에 누워버리는 장면을 목격하여 우려되는 경우가 있었습니다. 익년 1978년 9월에 뇌졸증으로 마비가 일부 오고, 1979년에는 목과 어깨의 척추 이상으로 
지휘전부터 눕고 있을 정도로 병세가 악화된 상태로 지휘하였습니다.

※数あるカラヤンの「第九」の中でも最も激烈な情熱を聴かせたとされる伝説的ライブ。爆発的なティンパニはフォーグラー。よく名前が取りざたされるテノールのベームですが、カラヤンは前年のザルツブルクでのルネ・コロとの決裂で「ローエングリン」の代演に使って以来、コロで予定していたこの公演や翌年からの「サロメ」の録音などに彼を起用していました。同じくコロで予定されていた同年の「第九」の正規録音ではシュライアーを起用していましたね。

Title: Beethoven Symphony No  4 - Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra - Karajan (Royal Albert Hall, London 1973)
Description:
This is part of an interesting concert given at the Royal Albert Hall, Lodon on 4 Jan 1973. It was part of the BBC Winter Proms 1972-1973. It was part of the "Fanfare for Europe" celebrations when the UK joined the European Community.

This concert also marked the only time that Karajan conducted the Berlin Philharmonic at the Royal Albert Hall, London to my knowledge (it was very kindly pointed out in a comment to the video that Karajan did appear with the Philharmonia at the Royal Albert Hall in 1948). Beethoven 4 occupied the whole of the first half of the concert and Beethoven 5 concluded it in the second half. I did have a recording of that Beethoven 5 but unfortunately the tape perished and was unrecoverable.

*UPDATE: The Beethoven 5 from this concert has very kindly been uploaded by Mark Hood and can be found here*

https://youtu.be/BQdQki6kcwc?si=5b3s9hKXPqYv6wWf

If you have listened to the Beethoven 4 then please do listen to the Beethoven 5 which formed the second half of the concert.

See https://www.bbc.co.uk/events/e2n3d4 for full details

This is part of a collection of live "off air" recordings from radio broadcasts I have made since 1970, and I have recently preserved by transferring from tape to digital format. Non of the recordings is derived from a commercial release, nor are they of commercial sound quality. No payment is sought for listening to these recordings, I am sharing them in the hope that they may give pleasure to other music lovers, as they have given pleasure to me. No copyright infringement is intended, please do contact me to allow me to correct the situation should this be the case.

Title: Brahms, Symphony no. 1 in C minor, op. 68 (Karajan/BPO/live in Washington, 1955)
Description:
Johannes Brahms. Symphony no. 1 in C minor, op. 68
Berliner Philharmoniker; Herbert von Karajan, conductor
Recorded live in Constitution Hall, Washington, D.C., 27 February 1955

I. Un poco sostenuto - Allegro (0:00)
II. Adagio - Più andante - Allegro non troppo, ma con brio (14:25)
III. Un poco allegretto e grazioso (23:26)
IV, Adagio - Più andante - Allegro non troppo, ma con brio (28:13)

“Here Karajan stays very close to the Furtwängler style. In the first place, the performance is grounded in that rich, rounded sound, peculiarly Furtwängler’s own, which Karajan inherited and so interestingly developed. Even more striking is the way the performance moves freely and naturally between a number of different tempi, while at the same time maintaining a larger rhythm, a longer line: a line that, for all its legato beauty, is never uniform in its articulation...Comparison between this live Washington performance and Karajan’s 1952 recording of the symphony with the Philharmonia Orchestra suggests that in the slow movement the Berliners were still playing Furtwängler’s performance. Where the Philharmonia-Karajan account of the Andante sostenuto is slow to the point of being comatose, the Berlin performance is grand and searching, hugely eloquent; a private salute, perhaps, to their former chief. It is also a wonderful example of the orchestra’s ability to take wing in performance.”—Richard Osborne, “Herbert von Karajan: A Life in Music”

※ブルックナーの聖地リンツに新設されたブルックナーハウスの杮落し公演に招聘された際の記録。この当時カラヤンはベルリン・フィルとの契約上ザルツブルク音楽祭以外でウィーン・フィルを振ることはありませんでしたが、この時はリンツ側のたっての願いということで実現しました。この年の秋カラヤンはベルリン・フィルを率いて来日、同曲の伝説的名演を残しましたが、NHKが放送した映像・音源はベルリン側が接収しており、幻の音源と言われています。

http://archiv.emilgilelsfoundation.net/discs/concerto-3-piano-orchestra-c-op-37/?fbclid=IwAR0gSChjep4iFLURCCJcs9FIu5MZOb8K8LjKPMpQmTvIrNUx6hNiv5dUK9k_aem_AaOMk-_G1pi7p9M7osyFpUmlhbU31Ele9i9DihJzeO8n8vxjlXj0uPIQ1yyaG7SnYic

Gilels Fondation Info



"Having performed Shostakovich’s Eighth under Kurt Sanderling at their first Salzburg series in 1965, it was Karajan’s turn to conduct the Tenth in 1976. In the first half, Emil Gilels – performing only once with Karajan – played Beethoven’s 3rd piano concerto. (The Shostakovich was recorded live and was released by our institute on a special-edition CD to mark the 50th anniversary of the Salzburg Easter Festival in 2017.)"

Title: Herbert Von Karajan at the Hollywood Bowl, Live 1959 [Remastered - 2019] MUST LISTEN
Description:
The Star-Spangled Banner 0:00
Wagner’s Die Meistersinger Overture 1:25
Mozart's Symphony No. 35 in D Major, K. 385 11:08
Charles Ives' "The Unanswered Question" 28:44

Remastered two different files from Herbert von Karajan's 1959 July 2nd concert with the Los Angeles Philharmonic at the Hollywood Bowl. First file was in a wrong pitch so I corrected this as well. Unfortunately with the Ives rendition (second file), there's a background static noise that I decided to keep it there because not getting rid of it would preserve the audio of actual performance. Hope you enjoy this one. 

Conductor: Herbert von Karajan, Austria
Orchestra: Los Angeles Philharmonic, USA
Date: July 2, 1959
Remastered By: Wayne Yang, USA-Taiwan

1970年6月、ウィーンで開催されたベートーヴェン生誕200年記念フェスティバルに、ウィーン楽友協会へ乗り込んだ公演のライブ録音。この直前には日本の万博に合わせて来日していて、大阪で伝説的なベートーヴェン・チクルスを敢行していました。来日公演は録音が存在しないので、その一端を知る貴重な記録となっています。燃焼度が高く、破格の勢いに満ちたカラヤン絶頂期の名演だと思います。

この映像以外のDVD版のジプシー男爵などは前半プログラムで、公開された中継映像は休憩後の

CDの正規録音は、この映像と微妙に演奏がいくつか異なります。

Title: Karajan's best Mahler Symphony No.5: with BPO, live in Salzburg (1978)
Description:
https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV15x411f7bY?from=search&seid=9818933530410024787

Translated by deepl:
This audio is of a live performance by Karajan and BPO in Salzburg on May 15, 1978, which differs from the studio version of the Rainbow covers of the 1970s. The overall style is similar to the recorded version, but the live performance is much more passionate than the rigorous and neutral recorded version, which coupled with BPO's excellent performance, makes for a climactic performance that can be said to have surpassed the studio version. The fact that this performance was the last of a total of nine live performances of Mahler's Fifth Symphony in his lifetime shows that he had no regrets after this performance.
From the introductory remarks we can assume that this recording was probably transcribed from a radio broadcast, and that the audio is clear, with good dynamics, but the resolution is unsatisfactory. Be able to see the light of day again.
In addition to this, Karajan has another version of Mahler's Fifth surviving, live from August 28, 1973, also with the Berlin Philharmonic, issued by FKM.

“The orchestra’s commitment was astonishing. Mariss Jansons would recall: ‘They played at two hundred per cent capacity. It was unbelievable.’ Shostakovich joined Karajan and the orchestra on stage afterwards, obviously moved by the performance and the reception he received. For Karajan, it was possibly the proudest moment of his life.”—Richard Osborne, “Herbert von Karajan: A Life in Music”

In this episode... Trevor is joined by entrepreneur, Dallas Mavericks owner, and television personality Mark Cuban. Mark recently announced that he’s selling his majority stake in the team and that he’s leaving the long-standing show Shark Tank after 15 seasons. Title: Mendelssohn Symphony no 3 "Scottish" Karajan
Description:
Mendelssohn Symphony no 3
Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra
Herbert von Karajan
Live at the Philharmonie Berlin
7 November 1972
This was the second half of an all Mendelssohn programme which was a
rarity for Karajan. He never programmed this work again.
The first half of the concert was the Hebrides Overture and the Violin Concerto with Michel Schwalbe´

Title: Walton : Symphony No.1 / Karajan & RAI Roma Orchestra (1953, Live) Artificial Stereo
Description:
Walton / Symphony No.1 in B-flat minor
Karajan & RAI Roma Orchestra (Rome 5 Dec.1953, Live)
Artificial Stereo by Fuyuhiko Sasaki Vol.12 Ⓟ2015
(Expansion of my Artificial Stereo’s sound is narrower than ordinary stereo. 
But I think it’s nearer to Karajan’s ideal sound than monaural sound.)

This is Karajan’s only performance of Walton’s 1st symphony.
Probably this orchestra could not fully respond to Karajan’s request.
But the performance is thrilling enough.
I wish you’d enjoy this performance.

Title: ブルックナー／交響曲第8番ハ短調／カラヤン（指揮）／ウイーンフィル（ザルツブルク音楽祭・1986年8月17日）
Description:
ブログ「寸草春暉」2016年5月5日
 http://blog.goo.ne.jp/tgcy2801
　昨年12月25日から紹介してきた「ブルックナーの交響曲」もこれが最後（たぶん）となりました。限られた期間のエア・チェックテープですから、指揮者・楽団に偏りがありますが、是非聴いてみてください。
　ブルックナーの交響曲には、シューベルト、モーツアルトのそれのように、口ずさめるようなメロディーはない。第4交響曲「ロマンティック」以外に、鑑賞のヒントになるような作曲家自身命名の「曲名」があるわけでもない。曲が長い、長すぎる。「ノヴァーク版」「ハース版」「初稿」・・いろんな版がありわけが分からない。
　今は気軽に聴きやすい環境が整っていますから、最初は「ながら聴き」ででも、パソコンでBGM風に鑑賞してみたらどうでしょうか。

シューマン：交響曲第2番
ヘルベルト・フォン・カラヤン指揮　ベルリン・フィルハーモニー管弦楽団
1972年1月9日　ベルリン、フィルハーモニーホール　ライブ録音
※元音源に音飛び等弱冠聞き苦しい箇所があります。カラヤンは第4番以外シューマンの交響曲をほとんど演奏しませんでした。スタジオ録音の全集はありますが。この2番もこの時が記録に残る唯一のライブ。翌月にスタジオ収録しているのでそのためにやってみたと言う感じでしょうか。しかしそれにしては素晴らしい演奏です。名演。
